definitions.text: a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles (as formed by leaves or flower petals)
American chemist who with Richard Smalley and Harold Kroto discovered fullerenes and opened a new branch of chemistry (born in 1933)
a strand or cluster of hair
form a curl, curve, or kink
examples: the cigar smoke curled up at the ceiling

definitions.text: shape one's body into a curl
examples: She curled farther down under the covers

definitions.text: wind around something in coils or loops
twist or roll into coils or ringlets
play the Scottish game of curling
